description: iostat - Report Central Processing Unit (CPU) statistics and input/output statistics for devices and partitions.

global_flags.description: The units displayed with this option supersede any other  default  units (e.g.  kilobytes, sectors...) associated with the metrics.

the Device Utilization Report easier to read by a human.  The device name will be printed on the right side. The report may also be broken into sub-reports if there are many metrics to display (use --compact option to prevent this).
This  option  must be used with option -g and indicates that only global statistics for the group are to be displayed, and not statis‐ tics for individual devices in the group.
Display the registered device mapper names for any device mapper devices.  Useful for viewing LVM2 statistics.
Print version number then exit.
Display the CPU utilization report.
Display the device utilization report.

an  alternative  directory for iostat to read devices statistics. Option -f tells iostat to use only the files located in the alternative directory, whereas option +f tells it to use both the standard kernel files and the files located in the  alternative  di‐ rectory to read device statistics.

statistics  for a group of devices.  The iostat command reports statistics for each individual device in the list then a line of global statistics for the group displayed as group_name and made up of all the devices in the list. The ALL keyword means that  all the block devices defined by the system shall be included in the group.
This option is equivalent to specifying --human --pretty.

persistent  device  names.  Keywords ID, LABEL, etc. specify the type of the persistent name. These keywords are not limited, only prerequisite is that directory with required persistent names is present in /dev/disk.  Optionally, multiple devices can be spec‐ ified in the chosen persistent name type.  Because persistent device names are usually long, option --pretty is  implicitly  set  with this option.
Display statistics in kilobytes per second.
Display statistics in megabytes per second.
JSON output field order is undefined, and new fields may be added in the future.

If a device name is entered on the command line,  then  statistics  for  it and all its partitions are displayed. Last, the ALL keyword indicates that statistics have to be dis‐ played for all the block devices and partitions defined by the system, including those that have never been used. If option -j is  de‐ fined before this option, devices entered on the command line can be specified with the chosen persistent name type.
Display a short (narrow) version of the report that should fit in 80 characters wide screens.
Print the time for each report displayed. The timestamp format may depend on the value of the S_TIME_FORMAT environment variable  (see below).
Display extended statistics.
Omit first report with statistics since system boot, if displaying multiple records at given interval.
Tell iostat to omit output for any devices for which there was no activity during the sample period.
